description: A precision physics puzzle game where you pop all balloons with limited darts.
rationale: This game focuses on trajectory calculation and physics-based interactions. It is designed for casual players who enjoy strategic aiming and provides a structured environment for AI agents to learn optimal angle and power variables in a 2D space.
details: The game consists of a static launcher at the bottom-left corner and various balloons distributed across the screen. Players must adjust the angle and power of a dart to hit and pop balloons. Some levels include obstacles (walls) and wind vectors that affect the dart's trajectory. Key entities include: 1. Darts: Projectiles affected by gravity. 2. Balloons: Target entities with circular hitboxes. 3. Obstacles: Rectangular blocks that deflect or destroy darts. 4. Wind: A global force vector updated per level. The game ends when all balloons are popped (win) or darts run out (loss).

game_mechanics.scoring: 100 points per balloon, bonus for remaining darts

how_to_play: The goal is to maximize the score by popping all balloons using the fewest darts possible. Controls: 1. Use UP/DOWN arrow keys to adjust the launcher angle. 2. Use LEFT/RIGHT arrow keys to adjust the shot power. 3. Press SPACE to fire the dart. Points are awarded immediately upon balloon collision. AI agents should observe the 'balloons_remaining' state and 'dart_count' to optimize rewards.
